intro: Geonoma camptoneura, commonly known as the bent-veined fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Davalliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its intricate, pinnate fronds with a distinctive, curved venation pattern. Its rhizomes are often covered in a dense, fibrous root system that helps anchor it to rocky substrates. Geonoma camptoneura thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
